entry.title: PubSubHubbub
entry.content:
We’re proud to announce that Superfeedr is one of the very first services to actually support the infamous PubSubHubbub protocol. If you think the name is ugly, check the CSS style of the spec.

This presentation should give you enough details about PubSubhubbub.

What does that mean for you superfeedr users? It means that you can get the ATOM payload of the feeds we parsed pushed to your endpoint url. Check our implementation notes to learn more.

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
Welcome to the Superfeedr’s blog. I am not sure what you expect from here. You know what a geek does when he’s embarrassed does, right? He gets into technical details.

This blog has been built with the great piece of code that Jekyll is. It is hosted on Github, and I used TextMate Version 1.5.8 (1498) to write it. I also used Git to push it on our Github repository. TextMate runs on my MacBookPro 2.53 Ghz Intel Core 2 Duo, with 4 GB of DD3 RAM. It’s about 85Â° F in the room in which I am working right now.

Welcome!
